Hi,

I am creating as-user-httptest.jar with 
following MANIFEST.MF file:

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Create-Date: 2-May-2003 04:32:13 AM
Main-Class: 
com.engage.as.user.httptest.TestLogin
Class-Path: httpunit.jar junit.jar


Here, httpunit.jar and junit.jar are the 
required external jar files. I have copied the 
files in the same directory where as-user-
httptest.jar file is. However, when I run it 
with following command:

java -jar as-user-httptest.jar

I get following exception on prompt, after the 
Junit popup window loads. ( However, The test 
case never got loaded. In fact it hangs)
"Exception in thread "main" 
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
com/meterware/httpunit/WebRequest"

This basically means that it is not finding the 
httpunit.jar which has 
com.meterwar.httpunit.WebRequest.class.


First of all, if any of httpunit.jar and 
junit.jar is missing then "java -jar as-user-
httptest.jar" does not start at all. It starts 
only when both httpunit.jar and junit.jar are 
in the same directory. So, I feel that it is 
READING "Class-Path: httpunit.jar junit.jar" 
from the manifest file correctly but somehow 
not LOADING httpunit.jar. 

Also, I am aware that setting $CLASSPATH does 
not help because once you say "java -jar", it 
expects everything to be in manifest file and 
ignores $CLASSPATH completely.

If I don't use .jar file and run following 
command, it works perfectly fine. ( So 
httpunit.jar is not corrupt or something OR 
there is nothing wrong with my java code :-) )

java -cp as-user-
httptest.jar:junit.jar:httpunit.jar 
com.engage.as.user.httptest.TestLogin


In summary, "java -jar as-user-httptest.jar" is 
loading junit.jar properly but not 
httpunit.jar. 

I guess the problem could be because of the 
classloader. While trying to run my test class, 
Junit could be loading the httpunit class using 
it's own classloader (Class.forName style), 
wouldnt't it? And since httpunit classes are 
not visible to Junit (since they are not in the 
system classpath), it throws an exception.


Am I missing something here?


Thanks in advance,
Vinayak
